metadata.description: Role-level benchmarks for healthcare IT SaaS companies at $1-3B revenue scale with managed services model. FTE_per_100M = typical FTEs per $100M annual revenue. Calibrated against a composite of healthcare IT peers including Epic, Cerner, Veeva, eClinicalWorks, NextGen. Sources: Technology & Services Benchmarking, SaaS Org Design studies, KLAS Research, MGMA, HFMA.
metadata.source: Composite of industry benchmarks for healthcare IT managed services vertical
metadata.context: athenahealth has ~$1.7B revenue and ~8,500 total employees. Benchmarks reflect industry medians â€” some roles where athena has invested in automation or runs lean will be below benchmark, while roles where complexity or service model drives headcount will be above.

roles.description: Lead implementation projects end-to-end; manage timelines, budgets, client stakeholders. Includes engagement management and scoping responsibilities (merged PM + EM).
Configure EHR/RCM to client requirements; build workflows, integrations, data migrations. Includes foundational build and table configuration.
Design technical solutions pre- and post-sale; tablespace architecture, integration scoping.
Develop and deliver product training, EUT agendas, clinical coaching, e-learning content.
Validate configurations, run UAT, regression tests, mock go-live validation.
Senior leaders managing practice areas, methodology, team staffing and complexity scoring.
Own post-go-live relationship; drive adoption, expansion, retention for named practices/health systems.
Manage contract renewal pipeline; negotiate terms, forecast churn. Healthcare IT: subscription + collections model.
Bridge between go-live and steady-state CSM relationship. Guide through first-value milestones.
Build and monitor health scores, usage analytics, churn-risk models.
Manage long-tail SMB practices via 1:many digital motions, webinars, automated campaigns.
Tooling, process design, reporting, territory planning for CS organization.
Handle inbound: password resets, claims questions, eligibility verification, basic how-to, patient portal issues.
Complex technical issues: integration failures, configuration errors, API connectivity, payer enrollment.
Scheduling, queue management, SLA tracking, workforce planning for 24/7 support.
Create and maintain help articles, troubleshooting guides, release notes, O-help content.
Manage P1/P2 incidents, outage response, executive escalations.
Review case quality, analyze CSAT/NPS, identify coaching opportunities.
Dedicated support for large health systems with enhanced SLAs.
